for baby her age to wake frequently sometimes they learn to sleep on their own through the night sometimes they do if she does then you can figure out way you want to try and get her on schedule know how you feel especially at days old when midnight nursing session can last the better half of an hour just hang in there mama and congratulations edit days not weeks thanks and my mom also said she breastfeeding but did produce enough to satisfy her then after we had already switched to formula my milk came flooding in she sleeps better with the formula so my husband said to just stick with it rather than flip flopping her again so it fine really to help try making days more bright and interactive fun engaging at night try make it more dull dark quiet easier said than done know really not trying to be pushy here but if your milk is still in do some research on why formula makes them sleep longer and decide which you want to do she days old so flip flopping wo matter much and if you ca handle this kind of strain my husband jokes and says no longer have an upper torso only have breast now haha oh yes easier said than done tried the night time bit on dark and dull but keeping her awake during the day is the bigger challenge but thank you ll keep on trying yeah mine swelled up to an cup too was spilling out of everything had it all been slow decline from there though and now only little bigger than my pre preggo size at months not bad highly respect your determination at only days old there is much you can do besides try to make the daylight bright and nighttime dark right now for you just sleep when the baby sleeps screw housework tell anyone who says damn thing about it to fuck off to be fair the size of your breasts will go down in few months after some weight starts to come off and the easiest way to get weight off is to breastfeed not saying it easy for everyone it not and not trying to pressure you either definitely did go to an cup but went from pre and the formula because colostrum does fill them up really still remember my baby satisfied milk drunk slump after my milk came in around day that felt good it does sound like your husband is very enthusiastic about the idea of you breastfeeding and like flewtea do mean to be pushy but since it still the first week maybe think seriously about what you want to do nursing is rough at first but the hard part is so brief in the grand scheme of things congratulations sorry just realized that sounded kinda scold was more reacting like days oh hell no do expect rhyme or reason for quite awhile for the first weeks of baby life you will be on baby time baby will eat poop sleep for hours and repeat for weeks there is no 24 hour schedule to be had at this point try to get as much sleep as you can but since she is so little she has to eat very frequently and will be awake to nurse lot trust us in another 10 days it will start to get better since babies go in to the pediatrician lot at this age feel free to discuss her sleep habits with her pediatrician at her next appointment to get some reassurance and or guidance not to mess with new mom with all the hormones everywhere but read your having music cleaning noises people talking the tv etc when she older and having or consistent naps day then you can have her in the crib or wherever and the dark during the day pounds lighter and cups sizes bigger than started do think it the weight that has much to do with it it had everything to do with it for me every body is different girl my little lady is months and she still wakes up at 4am and 7am just give it time you will be used to it and it is not so bad does she fall asleep to end feeding and you ca get her in the crib bassinet without waking thanks for the congrats was saying formula fed babies sleep better than breastfed ones it was just the mannerisms while breastfeeding she would toss and turn and had to constantly watch her so she would put her face in the bedding like she days old and did think they could turn on their sides at that point but she was weeks late so that may be part of why she can do know but with the formula she stays on her back it just been easier to relax with her it may have been fluke or because the colostrum did fill her and she was restless but do really want to chance switching back and if the same thing happens switching her back again you know she received all of my colostrum so at least there is that mean better some than none is what everyone says my husband was the one that was fully on board with breastfeeding he was somewhat my only support but he understands how uncomfortable and strained was with it we had to have an emergency section to have her and have really been able to bounce back from that surgery as well as thought could still have trouble carrying her and walking with her in my arms but try not to go too far holding her since he works nights and do want to double over while he not there it nothing against breastfeeding it just the situation at hand gave birth to our daughter and days later already at my pre pregnancy weight with the bigger breasts it bit daunting look like dolly haha my husband has been doing the housework when he awake while do all things baby related it then you realize he not very good at housework thanks for the advice do try and hush the house while she is sleeping just when my husband gets off of work and collapses usually around noon when he wakes up everything comes alive try to play with her little right now while she awake during the day which is very short amount of times but one second she is cooing and the next poof out like light and just ca bring myself to disturb her haha she cutie days old sorry but the only schedule newborn has should be having at that age is hungry now feed me ok and you feed them it gets better over time but it can honestly take some babies months to get on any kind of night time sleep schedule it ll happen on it own for now just go with it and enjoy being parents as arduous as it may seem right now and tiring of course our first appt will be tomorrow and had already made point in my head to bring it up to him hope he good guy he was recommended to us by many of our parent friends although we were warned he has thick viet accent which should be problem since my husband speaks vietnamese but do hope like him not many pediatricians are as close as he is to our home it is weird my mom was baffled because she said at night ate and slept and around noon was when peaked at being awake our little one peaks at night and is dead to the world during the day so did know if it was common occurrence do find it bad really get sleep when she sleeps but was just nervous be ruining her sleep schedule by enabling it but thanks to all you gals do feel she is normal now sorry first time mom so it all new to me did interact with many kids other than my godson at this size that does happen at night yes last night propped all kinds of pillows around me so that would topple over or shift and just let her sleep an hour on my chest after that hour she was up and ready to be adorable all the way till 3ams feeding then like always poof just dead tired and sleeps anywhere you put her guess it good thing that when she sleeps on me she holds my fingers like if she is holding someone hand she hold her own since the day she was born and it adorable but she holds my fingers and pulls them when she up also the shifting on sore breasts really has nothing compared to cup of coffee gah you re making me miss the chest sleeping phase you might be stuck with that until she little bigger older but we did twilight feeding give her some bottle then lay her down change her one last time then feed her the rest of her bottle in bed my daughter sleeps like champ like this she rejects the bottle when she is done and the whole thing takes 10 mins even if we have to get up in the middle of the night its ten mins and we never really wake up but do think we did this until she was months had an emergency section too it was really frustrating to take so long to heal was feeling good physically until weeks it was surprisingly tough on my body and emotions but even after weeks felt worlds better then every week and even every day saw improvements in my healing and mood you just have to take it easy on yourself now you ve been through lot and you need to heal but can almost guarantee that breastfeeding wo make any of that more difficult nor will your baby sleep more restlessly if you just are comfortable with the idea of doing it get that just wanted to dispel any worries that are probably unfounded if you have seen one yet lactation consultant can be hugely helpful went to weekly breastfeeding group for few months where could weigh him and get advice that super common it called reverse cycling you were just an easy baby it sounds like you are now slave to the baby haha good luck you might find that after couple weeks she ll start having more awake time and that might help to adjust her sleep schedule my son is almost weeks and some days he awake lot other days it seems like we barely see his eyes open our baby also was fond of 2am playtime as newborn he now weeks and sleeps well at night it took couple weeks to get his nights days sorted out so not sure if what we did helped or if it just was coincidence that he outgrew that phase we moved him from bassinet in our room to his crib in his own room when he was almost two weeks before that he had spent some of most nights in his swing in the living room as well he noisy little sleeper and keeps me up when we re in the same room he was up as long as your daughter but he frequently would have alert periods at 2am we started putting him in his swing for all his daytime naps and his crib at night we have nightlights in his room and we would keep all the lights off except the night lights during night feedings we go get the bottle before taking him out of his crib so he never leaves his bedroom at night we have an armchair in there daytime feedings are done in the living room we always swaddle him at night if he needs it we ll rock him in our arms standing next to the crib for few minutes before laying him down at first after many nighttime feedings we have to go back and rock him again every few minutes bunch of times but it gradually became fewer and fewer and now most nights he goes down the first time oh goodness lady unfortunately there is no such thing as schedule when your baby is that little the first few months are blur to me because everything was pretty much on baby time he slept lot but only in short spurts and totally get how difficult it is my little guy was night owl for the longest time but just chalked that up to the fact that my hubby and are also night owls remember feeling zombified during those first few weeks in particular since they wake so often and their schedule is so random you ve just got to push through and know that few months of life are very little compared to lifetime with great kiddo hehe sorry now you just reminded me that it goes away you are being unrealistic you ca put five day old on schedule she is way too young just suck it up and deal with it she will make her own schedule in time around months my daughter switched to *mostly* sleeping at nights she would still wake up times or so to feed but then went back to sleep immediately she is 15 months now and dealing with sleep regression or sorts because she is cutting *two molars at once* so she wakes up around times night oh yes we re starting routine now that is that effective but guess we re training ourselves too it goes bath feeding changing lotion massage she peeling bad and the nurses started that routine at the hospital and she seems to love it then place in bed and read book starts at and ends around wish knew of such supportive kn person community like that mean its nice online at breastfeeding but really do wish it was more personal envy that was mom said was only difficult when hit the teens years but before she said was perfect child think it was because my mom is *scary* haha thank you my grandmother has been trying to keep her awake all day she wanted to see her eyes it was such failed attempt was laughing at her frustration sorry new to this but thanks for the tough love really do understand the desire to get the baby on schedule would have done anything for good night of sleep at that stage well within reason but kind of just had to wade through it it will get easier promise every stage of development has it own challenges le leche league they offer very personal breastfeeding support from very experienced moms just google them to find one in your area oh and fwiw my almost year old still does sleep all the way through the night know you re sleepy and will continue to be ask your husband to take the baby when he gets home so you can sleep for little while my doctor told me that one hour chunk in 24 hour period is enough to not make you go crazy so try and aim for that good luck yes la leche league or if you happen to have kaiser their meetings are free some hospitals also have free breastfeeding groups would also look into postpartum support groups in your area found it so helpful to have weekly date with other new moms thank you for having confidence in me feel silly now with so many moms here sounding so disapproving of my ignorance all sounds very familiar first im dad but love reading mommit knew nothing about kids before had them my wife is an ex nanny and school teacher so she knows more then me but here are some things ve learned skip the books until they are months ish they do love songs memorize never ending song that you can sing if you are zombie reading is great but we have book selection the size of childrens section of library and they get old quickly rythem books are good for while then chapter books just ton of words charlotte web did wonders otherwise was reading stack of 20 short books continuous reading was the key and never stopping to have her pick new book but then we needed to teach her to sleep on her own so we switched to shorter books daughters two now and all it takes is one momma lamma and can leave the room without fussing read at least 30 books day with her assume the wife does more since she is home with her more plus she pages though double that number on her own the reading will come just do burn yourself out on it early do bathe every day my wife does the lotioning because frankly find it to be gross my daughter likes to lik it but only to annoy my wife she is fully of piss and vinegar also do rush shit they will walk and talk in time we are months into our second one and my wife always compares them just dont it pointless ve had the kids the last is months old now with him found pumping into bottles to be so so much easier he was restless just like you described it was so frustrating especially if was trying to breastfeed in public just not cool with having my boobies out in public he on formula now but we had pretty good run with pumping so much better for the engorgement pain too my first two were breast bottle formula combos as well really was just not into breast feeding but felt the first couple of months were important you re lucky your husband was supportive mine just could help taking about how weird it was real mature right but since did particularly enjoy doing it did drag it out the only thing you can really do at this age is make the days as bright and noisy as possible and the nights as dark and quiet as possible good luck when my daughter was born my brother told me to enjoy the newborn stage while it lasted because it truly unique time in child life and as stressful as it is it flies by kind of handwaved him at the time and have very healthy active 15 month old now but sometimes wish could have my tiny snuggly newborn back ca believe it was only year ago it seems like yesterday and an eternity all at once the sleepless nights suck lot especially if you are doing it alone you just have to grit your teeth get through it and enjoy all of the peaceful quiet cuddly moments you have together last night managed to keep her asleep all night long this morning she been awake so hopefully that transfers over to the following days sad thing was making sure she was asleep kept me up all night haha the only reason mention this is because it worked wonders for me bought my baby cocoon baby http www cocoonababy com au and she slept impossibly well it was cheap but it was definitely worth it because once she was in it on some nights though we would have to wait for her to stop crying and fall asleep she would wake up thereafter it was incredible if it makes you feel better mine only took month or so and to be honest that time is going to fly by and she ll be sleeping okay before you know it and you ll be saying my gosh hated all that no sleep but wish she were that tiny again lol well at least that what say edited to say that for the first several weeks slept in recliner gasp it made sleep possible for all of us was triple feeding and could literally just throw her on boob and pump the other other breast and switch without getting up afterwards we stopped the pumpnig at night and managed to get hours more sleep by just shifting her to the other boob hate that if staying up just waiting for him to wake up to eat that always when he sleeps extra long it like all this time could ve been sleeping sleeping in recliner too my breasts are so heavy that laying on my back without an incline makes it difficult to breath and ca lay on my sides because it hurts my section cut blegh anyway keep her bassinet near the recliner then just pick her up and rock her whenever she needs it without moving it convenient not mine wake her up to feed but it how slow she drinks it like she savoring every last drop think it funny because tend to nod off holding the bottle then jerk back awake yep actually preferred to breast feed at night and bottle feed during the day during the early weeks my last one has been truly awful sleeper so far he up every hours still if night goes by that he only up twice ecstatic and it took him until he was months old to stop waking every two hours my older son does need as much sleep as other kids and thinking this one will be the same my daughter slept like rock from day one and at will still nap every day and go to bed at it bizarre how different they are
